venue.name: Madison Park High School and John D. O'Bryant School of Mathematics and Science

item.description:
Come to the Science of Sports!
All families welcome!

Cost: Free!
Sunday, April 22, 2012
1:00pm-4:00pm
Madison Park High School and John D. O'Bryant School of Mathematics and Science, 75 Malcolm X Blvd., Roxbury (Map)


• How does a curveball curve, a knuckleball work, and a fastball actually rise?
• Ever seen a robot shoot hoops?
• Who is Carmine and what the heck is sabermetrics?
• Want to jump higher than a prima ballerina or out-run Ellsbury?

Dive into workshops, demonstrations, talks, and activities with athletes, trainers, video game makers, sports medicine doctors, architects, and scientists! Make concession-stand ice cream with liquid nitrogen!!

Thank you to Mayor Thomas M. Menino, the Boston Red Sox, and the MIT School of Engineering.

Andy Andres will again being presenting at the Cambridge Science Festival.  Based on the success of his talks in the past we've expanded the event and created an whole Science of Sports Day.

<<Site Link>>
item.how_to_find_us: Stick your tongue on the Tesla coil... we will find you.
item.name: Science of Sports
